Très heureuse de partager le GreenBook, notre guide des méthodes d#éco-innovation, coconçu avec Manadvise et les étudiants du track Strategy & Consulting de lEM Normandie Business School pour le programme TotalEcosolutions (https://lnkd.in/d8jGWB9) Selon que vous cherchiez à améliorer limpact environnemental dun produit, process ou service existant (approche incrémentale), à développer un nouveau produit éco-conçu (approche radicale) ou à redéfinir une proposition de valeur éco-innovante (approche disruptive), le GreenBook vous accompagne dans la mise en application des éco-innovations de demain.  Merci Benjamin Lehiany pour le pilotage du projet, Taha Benmoussa pour laccompagnement des étudiants, et bravo à @Laurie Bignalet, @Guillaume Laurent, @Maxence Plessis, @Marine Simon et Louis Merienne pour ce travail exceptionnel ! #ecoinnovation, #ecodesign, #openinnovation, #impact Lorenzo Croati David Baruchel Pierre Prat Jean-Charles Pierre GUILLET François HOT Bérénice Bougard sylvain clemendot Florent Bertini Axel Dachouffe Virginie Hurmane Maria Claudia ALVAREZ Caroline Jamin Claire Le Louët .... une inspiration ? Good day, dear connections! I'm currently conducting my research on eco-innovation in the food industry within the Netherlands. I'm fascinated with how companies here perceive, process, and respond to various pressures, and how they use eco-innovation in their approach.  In pursuit of this study, I am inviting anyone working within the food industry in the Netherlands for a 10-15 minute interview, or if you know anyone that does, feel free to tag them in this post. This would build towards the development of this study, and would be immensely appreciated! Thank you and have a nice day, everyone. #connections #foodindustry #ecoinnovation #sustainability #Nederland "

Glad to share that my paper together with Pablo del Rio and Totti Könnölä entitled "Diversity of eco-innovations: Reflections from selected case studies", published in 2010 by the Journal of Cleaner Production, has reached 1000 citations according to Google Scholar. I am honored to see the research undertaken for my Master's thesis published as an article by the Centre for International Environmental Studies | Graduate Institute Geneva. By analyzing the scope of eco-innovation in the #wastemanagement sector in Switzerland, I was able to illustrate that, although the Swiss waste management system is often praised for its merits, there is still an abysmal gap to be bridged for Switzerland to achieve its #environmental goals. To bridge this gap, a #paradigmshift in consumption and production patterns towards a more #circular and integrated system is called for, and this requires above all institutional and social #ecoinnovations.   I would like to warmly thank Professor Joëlle Noailly for guiding and mentoring me throughout these months of research and for giving me the opportunity to publish it. As this article also marks the end of my academic cursus and the completion of my Master's degree, I would like to express my gratitude for these last two years spent at Graduate Institute of International and Development Studies. It has been a rich and constant learning experience for me, both from my professors and my classmates, whose diverse perspectives have strengthened my critical thinking and convictions.   Please do not hesitate to contact me for more information or to access the full thesis report.         "

This article critically reviews the exemplary eco-innovations (technological and non-technological) including resource recovery and viable technologies for solid waste management in India. It also illustrates the lacunae in the waste management system and recommendations based on findings and future research areas. The paper can also assist researchers, entrepreneurs, and policymakers in improving the status of SWM in India as well as other developing countries with the same societal and economic status.   First review article as the main author and second published article in the research area of solid waste management. Thanks to Dr. Sunil Kumar and National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (NEERI) for giving me this opportunity. Many congratulations and thanks to Shubham Patel for being a supportive co-author.  #ecoinnovations #research #solidwastemanagement #india #smarttechnologies #circulareconomy '

[ Ateliers Eco-Innovation  FERTILWASTES - 4 février et 17 mars ]   . A vos agendas !    Dans le cadre du projet de recherche Interreg POCTEFA - Communauté de Travail des Pyrénées #FERTILWASTES,   l'APESA - Christine Ferrer, Audrey Lallement, Benjamin Tyl  - organise deux ateliers d'Eco-Innovation les 4 février et 17 mars,  sur la Technopôle Agrolandes à Haut-Mauco (40)    Le pitch : Imaginer, collectivement (fournisseurs de matières premières,  producteurs, utilisateurs), des solutions à forte valeur ajoutée pour valoriser les co-produits agricoles et industriels. Ce sera l'occasion de questionner les solutions existantes  quant à leur contexte dutilisation, leurs modèles  économiques et sociaux, les obstacles potentiels divers.  Ces ateliers, animés par Benjamin Tyl, utiliseront des outils et méthodes déco-innovation simples et intuitives qui pourront être facilement réutilisées dans le cadre de vos projets.   Pour participer à l'atelier du 4 février : https://lnkd.in/gZZ3QGfZ  Contact : Christine Ferrer    Partenaires : CATAR agro ressources, BETA  - Universitat de Vic  Universitat Central de Catalunya (UVic-UCC), LATEP, NEIKER BRTA,  Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya  #ecoInnovation #agriculture #agroalimentaire #Aquaponie #rechercheetdeveloppement #innovation #economieCirculaire #durabilité  #recherche #agro #landes #nouvelleaquitaine #microalgues #pyrolyse #digestat, #compost #engrais #fertilisant "

[NEW #researchpaper]   Exploring how #businesses can adopt #ecoinnovation, which may involve their #marketexpansion, and meet their #climatechange targets, was the goal of  Assessing handprint potentials for business's eco-innovation #researchpaper co-authored with Elizabeth Moore, Christian Bauer Randolph Kirchain, Jeremy Gregory & led by Gregory Norris & published in Sustainable Production and Consumption Journal.   Potential #handprint pathways were defined from the perspectives of two actors who can bring about the change: #business & #consumers.   We provided a systemic approach for #businesses to adopt #ecoinnovations, pursue market expansion & reduce overall sector's #climatechange impacts, and relevance for #consumers in adopting #ecoinnovation.   This research demonstrated measurement of #businesses and #consumers #positiveimpacts by shifting (#marketchange & #behavioralchange ) to #ecoinnovation and #communication of this information using the Sustainability and Health Initiative for NetPositive Enterprise (SHINE) #handprint and #netpositive assessment methods.  This research expands the way of thinking about climate change as a mitigation problem only as well as seeking solutions either in businesses or consumers behavioral change. It requires seeking solutions both in businesses and consumers. Thus, the most important contributions of this research are in extending the scope of the assessment, scaling up to global markets, and examining handprint relevance for an organization and consumers.   SIG Combibloc provided a case study and data for their #ecoinnovation in milk #packaging. This research will help their #handprint implementation efforts to drive #positivechange for the #packagingsector, #customers & #consumers. The results may inspire others to shift their businesses from focusing only on environmental management to becoming drivers of #sustainabledevelopment.  We thank the editor, Prof. Shabbir Gheewala, and reviewers for their recommendations and a balanced turnaround in processing our paper.         "

Our 2022 kick-off Eco-Innovation event will introduce you to Innovation Lounges' online platform, with special guest TIMØ Ronan, Chief Creative Officer, Innovation Lounges.  Please join us as we peek into Innovation Lounges' Collaborative Design Platform. Clients will create, review, iterate & validate product designs online in real-time 3D and augmented reality, anchored by Emersya 3D cloud tech innovation.  In a traditional workflow, a company goes through thousands of physical product samples in a year. Time, expense, materials, human resources, fuel, and market share get lost in the production and delivery of every single sample. The Innovation Lounges Collaborative Design Platform allows non-technical teams to create, review, iterate and approve colorways online. With Virtual Prototyping, design development time, waste, and expenses decrease exponentially. Customized products are designed with high fidelity 3D visualization while feeding brand member PLMs automatically.   As part of Innovation Lounges' eco-innovation mission, a Collaborative Virtual Design Platform will significantly help its brand members and clients reduce their carbon footprint (and time to market).  11 AM EST - Collaborative Virtual Design Eco-Innovation Talk on Zoom  5-7 PM EST - Collaborative Virtual Design Eco-Innovation Happy Hour at Innovation Lounges Miami #innovation #design #development #circulardesign #rapidprototyping #metaverse #collaborativeworking #collaborativelearning #ecoinnovation #innovationlounges #hospitality #travel #thefutureisgreen #thefutureiselectric #thefutureisnow "

Strategic partnership for AGRI-entrepreneurship and EcoInnovation - AgriEco project, financed under the ERASMUS+ PROGRAMME, Key Action 2: Cooperation for innovation and the exchange of good practices, Strategic partnerships in the field of education, training and youth, Agreement n°2019-1-BG01-KA203-062284, KA 203/HE-26/17-09-2019 creates synergies from complementary knowledge, skills and resources, and generates a unique value in providing real solutions and tangible responses to support HE students in the field of agricultural entrepreneurship. The project is not an alternative to the formal education but rather a stepping stone to smoothing the transition from university to work, including: improved portfolio offering a tailor-made advanced training; acquisition of new competencies and experience; new training models and development of news disciplines; and change (in different degrees but still) of the attitude towards the connection education2business.  Our specific objectives are: SO1: Better integration of the education within the European research community SO2: Upgrading learning and training capacity and capability SO3: Improved educational capacity for regional economic and social development AgriEco partners are: Trakia University (BG)  Coordinator Agricultural University (BG) University of Macedonia (GR) Pavlodar State Pedagogical University (KZ) Canakkale Onsekiz Mart Universitesi (TR) Center for research and analysis (BG) ZIP center (RS) #AgriEco #experience #innovation #education '

Environmental pollution is a major issue that is increasingly worsening. The current level of investment in recycling and waste segregation, as well as the use of eco-innovations in the waste management economy, is inadequate. The situation is only getting worse.  It is important to dramatically increase spending on recycling, scale-up waste segregation systems, and employ eco-innovation in waste management, including the implementation of strategies for the restoration of contaminated waste heaps and the elimination of plastic waste from the land and water system, including seas and oceans. What's your opinion on this? . . . . #segregation #wastesegregation #ecoinnovation #recycling #recycle #wastemanagement #recycling "

Happy to see our more recent paper on #circulareconomy published in the last issue of the journal Business Strategy and the Environment:   https://lnkd.in/dXh_jwu  Our results have particular implications for (infrastructural) systemic lock-in. For practitioners willing to develop the highest levels in the circular economy (CE) hierarchy, our results imply that a detailed analysis of the long-term implications for the company of adopting a given eco-innovation (EI) should be carried out. Identifying which EIs contribute or constrain the achievement of the CE in companies is an important step towards empowering practitioners, policymakers and researchers to identify effective EI pathways towards the CE.   #circulareconomy #ecoinnovation #sustainability '

Join the NON STOP project´s free Webinar : DIGITALISATION OPPORTUNITIES FOR PORT MANAGEMENT on 8th April 2021, 10h30-12h CET. NON-STOP (New smart digital Operations Needed for a Sustainable Transition of Ports) is a 4,7m initiative, 50 % co-funded by European Regional DevelopmentFunds (ERDF) under the North Sea Region Programme 2014  2020; Ecoinnovation priority. Partners: Ports of Zwolle, Port of Oostende, Niedersachsen Ports GmbH & Co. KG - Niederlassung Emden (Port of Emden), Port of Korsør, Port of Helsingør, CRESCENT NV, GreenBridge NV, BPK - Rechtsanwaltkanzlei Friederike BergPackhäuser & Kollegen (Port of Narvik - supporting partner). #ports #digitalisation #portmanagement '

This month our colleague Ana de Jesus  has had her paper Eco-Innovation Diversity in a Circular Economy: Towards Circular Innovation Studies published in the open access journal MDPI Sustainability.  The paper addresses the gap of in-depth research exploring eco-innovation dynamics within circular economy by taking advantage of the burgeoning research on circular eceonomy of the last 20 years and offers a new working synthesis. By implementing a (systematic) review of (systematic) reviews, the paper provides a new comprehensive framework for understanding pro-circular innovation strategies and, as a complement, argues the need to advance circular innovation studies as an agenda in its own right.  Congratulations to Ana and her co-authors!  View the full article: https://lnkd.in/dvHSW5Yj #Sustainability #Ecoinnovation #Circulareconomy Technopolis Group https://lnkd.in/dz8qjGxw '

Tomorrow is Giving Tuesday! Its one of the biggest giving days of the entire year. Please consider supporting Uptown Partners of Pittsburgh as we work to build a smart, sustainable, and just community for all of our residents and stakeholders.   Over the past year, we've improved our public art initiatives, developed a strategy to tackle blight and abandonment, worked toward goals set forth in Pittsburgh's EcoInnovation District Plan, advocated for safe housing for residents, built new and valued partnerships, enhanced and acquired greenspace, and so much more. We are thankful for our community of people and partners, like you, who make our work possible.   As thanks for an e-donation, you'll be entered for a chance to win 2 tickets to any upcoming show at PPG Paints through the end of the year.  You can donate through PayPal (@UptownPartners), and checks can be made payable to "Uptown Partners of Pittsburgh, 445 Fort Pitt Blvd, Suite 240, Pittsburgh, PA 15219". Located in Pittsburghs EcoInnovation District, Fifth & Dinwiddie models a multipronged approach to sustainable design. A mixed-use, mixed-income development, the site will offer commercial office space, co-working space, housing units and retail space. Its Passive House design strategies will help reduce energy consumption by 70% compared to the regional average for its building type. The development will be net-zero ready but is striving for full net-zero energy with the inclusion of rooftop solar arrays. Thanks for highlighting this project Realcomm! https://bit.ly/3beTJLM Derrick L. Tillman Amanda Markovic #buildings #buildingdesign #sustainabledesign #architecture #design '

Hey Everyone! Check out our Eco-conscious label! Our Eco-conscious label is designed to reward those who care about our environment and a Greener Economy! We are part of a do-good business network, that believes in the future of a greener and more socially equitable economy. We seek to offer you and your company a set of tangible benefits including the following: - An opportunity to be featured in our monthly newsletter and digital marketing platform showcasing your business to our networks. Introductions and business synergy exchanges, between our members. - Free expert talks and seminars hosted online on how to increase your bottom line through implementing the "ecoinnovation" approach in your business. - Access to research and development capabilities to enhance your business' sustainability practices.  - Access to services and products for your waste to be transferred into bio-fuels for your own use and thereby saving on fuel costs. - Our gold members and clients will receive cost reductions on certain products and services after 12 months. To get your Eco-conscious label and be part of this movement, please email sales@sustnet.com. www.kulubiofuels.com '

Doing research on SMEs, I have come across the Future Brief: Eco-innovation in SMes report by the European Commission, which I would like to share with you.  SMEs main barriers and drivers for the adoption of eco-innovation are outlined as well as some solutions for accelerating this process of eco-innovation.  Acknowledging that numerous European initiatives have already been created to promote and support SMEs to eco-innovate, which I invite you to have a look on, I would like to remark the importance of Open innovation solutions. They are focused on knowledge sharing, networking, and clustering, where multiple SMEs or other actors cooperate to help the exchange of knowledge and resources with broader networks.   Better knowledge and understanding are key components to help SMEs to grasp eco-innovation opportunities and position themselves as key players in the green transition.  Thanks Daniel Truran for your enlightening lectures.   #SMEs #ecoinnovation #sustainability #greentransition '

How can organizations promote sustainability by using resources more consciously and responsibly?   The answer to this question is Eco-innovation, a model that contributes to a more sustainable world that benefits businesses, improves people's quality of life and reduces environmental impacts. In other words, everyone wins.    This sustainability-oriented innovation brings numerous advantages, such as:   Reducing environmental impacts;  Optimization of the use of natural resources;  Promotes more conscious consumption;  Allows for ecological economic growth;  Economically favours companies;  Improves the quality of life of citizens.   Read more about this topic in our article:  http://ow.ly/fPaL50ENrfK #ecoinnovation #sustainability #sustainabledevelopment #circulareconomy #ecology #consciousconsumption #circularcities #zerowaste #beecircular #beegreen #beecreative #beethefuture #beethechange #beesocial "

content: Samson Rajarata Tiles (Pvt) Ltd of DSI Group signed an MOU with NCPC Sri Lanka, to engage in the project activity  on Eco-innovation. Mr. Wipul Kularathna, General Manager from Samson Rajarata Tiles (Pvt) Ltd, Ms. Lakmini Edirisinghe, Senior RECP Expert of NCPC & Project Coordinator participated at the occasion with few other staff members from both organizations. Gratitude to The Earthshot Prize Nominators, who give me optimism.   Why?   They operate in every part of the world. They work in venture, business, academia, not-for profit, research, foundations, movements and technology.  They work in oceans, biodiversity, waste, clean air and/or climate. They touch all parts of our society. Their lens on the world is deeply diverse.   Yet they're are all united by a shared vision. A vision of accelerating us all to a more equitable, just, sustainable world.    Watching our nominators put out calls to their networks for nominees is to get a glimpse into the world through all their eyes. It's like diving beneath the waves to suddenly find seascapes that lay hidden from the shore.   This is what we see:  Beneath the waterline, there is huge, vibrant unseen, often fragmented and isolated seascape of brilliant, diverse eco-innovators changing the world for good.  That's what we're going to change with The Earthshot Prize.   This is the decisive decade.   Eco-innovators & their solutions are not all the answer, but they will play a pivotal role. We're going to spotlight their work. We're going to make them easier to find. We're going to catalyze support for them and the scaling of their solutions.   Nominators will be submitting nominations right up until midnight of March 4th.   Information on nominators, our nomination process and The Earthshot Prize and a sign up for our newsletter is all at  www.earthshotprize.org.  #biodiversity #technology #business #sustainable #society #sustainability #prize #innovation #oceans #cleanair #climatechange #climatetech #ecoinnovation #entrepreneurship "

[INNOVATION] Avez-vous entendu parler de la loi sur l'interdiction de destruction des invendus non alimentaires ?  A partir du 1er janvier 2022, il sera obligatoire pour les producteurs, importateurs et distributeurs de produits manufacturés de réemployer, réutiliser ou recycler leurs invendus. Vous êtes concernés par cette loi ?   Grâce à notre centre essai, l'équipe éco-innovation MTB a la capacité de tester la recyclabilité de vos produits. L'année passée, pas moins de 5 000h d'essais réalisés sur nos machines pour développer des solutions industrielles de recyclage.  L'innovation chez MTB en 2021, c'était 8 millions d'euros répartis sur 15 projets thématiques. A chaque projet, son étude et sa caractérisation préalable sur notre démonstrateur.   Vous avez besoin d'accompagnement ? Contactez notre équipe pour plus de renseignements !    #LoiEconomieCirculaire #Recycling #Innovation #MoreThanBusiness #Engineering #EcoInnovation #R&D #InvendusNonAlimentaires "

Biodegradable, non-toxic glitter? THIS!   Making plant-based alternatives to glitter is a wonderful innovation. I must admit, I get really frustrated when people go to natural spaces to take graduation, prom, or other celebratory photos and throw glitter.   I can always tell when it happens because when I start to see glitter floating in waterways creating patches of microplastics that will pollute the ecosystem for centuries.  Before these kinds of things get to market, lets normalize celebrating things by AVOIDING polluting natural spaces. Instead, throw rice, bits of lavender, or even punched out leaves.   #ecoinnovation #glitter #microplastic '

Do you channel your worries about the environment into optimistic action? Or know anyone whose environmental work highlights ingenuity and inspires positive change? The Earthshot Prize may be for you!  The Prize is on the lookout for eco-innovators with groundbreaking solutions that can repair and regenerate the planet. Clean our air, revive our oceans, protect and restore nature  these are the Earthshots or ambitious goals that the Prize aims to achieve by 2030. Each of the 5 selected Earthshots will receive £1M in funding and their work will be broadcast globally during their awards ceremony.   Nominations will be accepted until March 4, 2022. Check www.earthshotprize.org to learn more about the kind of breakthrough solutions theyre looking for.   --- Smarter Good promotes #EpicPartnerships between nonprofits and foundations. I have always believed that new technologies can be an important factor supporting us on the path of sustainable development. Here is another example of this! The Baltic Sea, one of the most polluted seas in the world, will have a digital twin. This interesting technology can help model the impact of human activities on the Baltic ecosystem and thus design solutions that benefit not only the economies and industries connected to the sea, but also the marine environment. Simulations of this kind will make it possible to avoid costly and difficult-to-repair mistakes. This is what designing for the future looks like! https://lnkd.in/dr33FbFA #digitaltwin #ecoinnovation #newtechnology #climatechange '

| Aus der Natur. Zurück zur Natur. | From nature. Back to nature. |  Mit unserem neuen inspirierenden Give-Away aus reinpapier® retten wir sogar Bienen, denn unsere Saatbombe ist mit einer "hochexplosiven" Wildsamenmischung befüllt. Wenn sich das Material in der Erde auflöst, wachsen wie aus Zauberhand tolle Blumen, die unseren fleißigen Bienen den nötigen Lebensraum schenken.  Besuchen Sie uns doch auf unseren Messen #empack #logimat #fachpack. TEAMING UP TO REMOVE PLASTIC WASTE FROM THE AUSTRALIAN OPEN  Australian enviro-tech startup, Samsara has teamed up with Tennis Australia to help reduce plastic waste at this years Australian Open (AO). The partnership sees Samsara collect tennis players discarded single-use plastic bottles and divert it to its Canberra recycling lab so it can be infinitely recycled.  Samsara launched last year on a mission to help end the plastic pollution crisis. Of the 2.5 million tonnes of plastic waste generated each year, only nine percent is sent for recycling while 84 percent ends up in landfills. The issue is current recycling methods are inefficient, time intensive and costly, and do not allow all plastic to be recycled (like coloured bottles) or recycled repeatedly without degradation.   Samsara has pioneered a new approach to infinitely recycle plastic. Using plastic-eating enzymes, Samsaras technology breaks down plastic back to its core building blocks so it can be recreated into brand new plastic, again and again. The process is carbon-neutral, environmentally friendly and doesnt require any change to consumer behaviour. During the two-week Australian Open, Samsara is expected to collect approximately 5,000 single-use water bottles.  The partnership comes through Tennis Australias venture arm, Wildcard Ventures, which has taken an investment position in Samsara. Wildcard Ventures joins existing founders including Woolworths Group, The Australian National University and deep tech venture fund, Main Sequence founded by CSIRO, who have joined forces to tackle the plastic waste problem with leading edge science.  As part of Samsaras mission to address the plastic crisis, it is also gearing up to launch an education campaign aimed at helping Australians understand the plastic problem and potential solutions, via its sub brand, Sam. Follow it via Instagram: @sam.for.change. Read Waste + Water Management Australia online or download for FREE at: https://lnkd.in/gUnnmSvp #recycling #reduceplasticwaste #lesswaste #sustainablefuture #ecoinnovation '

ADEME ESI GREEN & SOCIAL BUSINESS SCHOOL   Récap sur la semaine européenne de réduction des déchets qui s'est déroulé à l'IUT de Saint-Denis  Dans le cadre de la SERD2021 - ADEME  (https://www.serd.ademe.fr/)   Les étudiant(e)s du Double Module « Principes Fondamentaux et Stratégies du Développement Durable » ont participé jeudi 25 novembre à l’action  de collecte et pesée des déchets organisée par la Commission Développement Durable de l’IUT de St-Denis.  A l'issu de cette journée, 10Kgs de plastique (bouteilles, touillettes, gobelets, petits emballages, …) ont été ramassés.  De plus, nous avons pu assister à la mise en place de bacs de collecte et recyclage de déchets électriques et piles ou accumulateurs.  Le saviez-vous   Le secteur du développement durable  est un secteur attractif qui possède diverses professions en lien avec la formation GEA. Meilleure intégration dans le tissu économique local, meilleure image, meilleure performance…   Vous pouvez devenir : - un(e) chargé(e) de communication en développement durable ; - un(e) chargé(e) d'achats responsable ; - un(e) consultant(e) en développement durable ; - un(e) chef(fe) de projet en green marketing et eco-design, .... Et pleins d'autres encore  Après l'obtention de votre DUT ou BUT, plusieurs choix s'offre à vous. Vous pouvez donc soit suivre une formation qui peut se faire à distance ou en physique                             ou soit intégrer une grande école en formation ou en alternance  Vous pouvez choisir par exemple, l'ESI Business Schoool qui est une école de commerce et de management spécialisée en développement durable.  Chacun peut donc contribuer à sa manière   #dutgea #iutdesaintdenis #developpementdurable #poursuitesdetudes

European Union has announced plans to set regulations that would help tackle fast fashion by targeting the design and manufacturing of various textile goods.  These regulations - which would fall under eco-design rules that ensure energy efficiency standards of electronics, for instance - might even extend to other commodities to help European Union reduce its ecological and carbon footprint.  The potential regulations are bound to increase the service life and post-consumer recycling for the commodities, though the plans to apply these rules for clothes and footwear are not finalized yet,  mattresses and carpets are likely to be the candidates for the first phase of EU eco-design regulation.   Since almost 75% of clothing and textiles in the EU are imported, the suggested restriction would have a far and wide impact on the fast fashion industry across the globe.  #TheSustainableBrandsJournal #fastfashion #sustainablefashion #fashion #slowfashion #beauty #sustainable #zerowaste #upcycle #Europe #waste #recycle #reducereuserecycle #reuse #slowliving #ecofriendly #environmentallyfriendly #organic #cotton #design #sustainabledesign #innovation #business #shoplocal #climatechange #pollution #thrift #circulareconomy #ethicalfashion #fashionindustry #textile #textiles #recycling #europeanunion #manufacturing #clothing #energy #electronics #help

Avoir plus de 45 ans en 2022 Et rechercher un job ? C'est le parcours du combattant....  Trop de préjugés, de biais, d'aprioris :  Trop senior, trop d'expérience, trop d'égo, Trop cher, trop fatigué, trop malade, trop vieux, Trop grande gueule, trop de savoirs, trop décalé, Trop boomer, trop prétentieux, trop de prétentions, Trop peu manageable, trop de temps pour le former, Trop loin des nouvelles technologies, trop près de la tombe....  Pourtant, physiquement, les seniors n’ont jamais été aussi en forme. Alors, que faire jusqu’à cette retraite qui s’éloigne de jour en jour, Sachant que tous n’ont pas spécialement envie de créer leur boite ?  J’invite les entreprises à participer à l’effort collectif et sociétal, En revoyant leur politique de recrutement sur fond de jeunisme. J'invite l'état à les aider pour ne pas laisser les seniors dans la rue. Je vous invite à changer votre regard sur les profils expérimentés !  D'abord, parce qu'ils ont contribué à créer la société d'aujourd'hui, Ensuite, parce que qu'ils apportent une vraie valeur aux entreprises. Grâce à leur expérience, leurs compétences et leurs soft-skills….  Ce que je vous propose c’est de mettre en commentaires les raisons qui font que l’on peut considérer que les seniors valent de l’or  et les solutions pour ne pas laisser disparaitre cette richesse.  Je suis également preneuse de jolies histoires d'entreprises qui vont dans le sens de la #MarqueEmployeur  et donnent leur chance aux boomers   Merci pour votre contribution  Très belle journée à tous   #EmployeurDeMarque #TrouveurdEmploi

China will not be in a position to save Russia   Despite a strong alliance demonstrated against camera 1 month ago, China can not pose as a savior of Russia. China exported about $67bn of goods to Russia in 2021, this figure rises to $576bn for the USA and $701bn for Europe. Beijing has too much to lose in trade links by supporting Russia. A violation of the sanctions applied to Russia could lose access to markets developed by Chinese companies. The U.S. Treasury Department, through the Countering America's Adversaries Through Sanctions Act, has the legal right to impose secondary sanctions on companies that engage in transactions with blacklisted countries. The loss of access to the US market is a risk that only few Chinese banks can afford.   But beyond the financial aspects, technology companies are also extremely dependent on American sanctions: remember the embargo on chips for Huawey... Uncle Sam's technology is vital for Chinese industry such as semi-conductors. On the energy side, a sector spared from sanctions due to Europe's dependence on gas and oil, China cannot counterbalance the loss of demand for Russian energy due to gas pipelines that are too limited and not connected to the infrastructure distributing Europe. Loyalty to its alliance or preservation of its economy? In any case Xi Jinping is faced with a dilemma.  #Russia #China #Sanction #USA #markets #energy #economy

Aujourd’hui, nous célébrons la journée mondiale du recyclage. Cette journée a été créée afin de sensibiliser sur l'importance du recyclage pour préserver nos ressources et assurer l'avenir de notre planète.  Chez Sothys, l'environnement et le développement durable sont au cœur de nos préoccupations. Au-delà de créer des emballages les plus éco-conçus possibles, Sothys s’engage à stopper le plastique dans les océans et à améliorer les conditions de vie en collaboration avec Plastic Bank. La gamme Sothys Organics ainsi que toute la gamme corps Évasion sont Certifiées Plastic Neutral par Plastic Bank.   Ce qui signifie que 1 kg de plastique utilisé = 1 kg de plastique en provenance des océans collecté et recyclé.  @plastic bank #environment #avenir #future #environnement aide le monde à mettre un terme au rejet de plastique dans les océans, tout en améliorant la vie des communautés vulnérables de collecteurs. Plastic Bank crée des écosystèmes de recyclage éthiques dans les communautés côtières et retraite les matériaux collectés pour les réintroduire dans la chaîne d'approvisionnement mondiale. #revedebeautebydona _  Today is Global Recycling Day. A day dedicated to raising awareness and celebrating the importance that recycling plays in preserving our primary resources and securing the future of our planet.  At Sothys, the environment and sustainable development are at the heart of what we do. As well as creating packaging that uses eco-design, Sothys is committed to stopping ocean plastic and improving collectors’ lives in collaboration with Plastic Bank. Our Sothys Organics range and our Escape body range are Certified Plastic Neutral by Plastic Bank.   This means, every 1 kg of plastic used = 1 kg of ocean-bound plastic is collected and recycled.  Plastic Bank  is helping the world stop ocean bound plastic while improving the lives of vulnerable coastal communities. They build ethical recycling ecosystems in coastal communities and reprocess the collected materials for reintroduction into the global manufacturing supply chain.

Quel sera l'impact du déploiement de la #5g sur l'empreinte carbone du réseau d'accès à l'Intenet mobile? C'est la question que Louis Golard s'est posée dans le cadre de son travail de fin d'études à l'Université catholique de Louvain. Il s'agit d'un des premiers travaux à utiliser une approche quantitative et scientifique pour répondre à cette question. Ce travail, réalisé en collaboration avec Proximus et supervisé par moi-même et Jérôme Louveaux, est primé par un HERA Award Sustainable IT. Pour découvrir la réponse à cette question (spoiler: ça ne va pas spécialement dans la bonne direction, surtout si la 5G s'accumule à la 4G, il y a du boulot pour adopter de la sobriété), suivez le webinaire de la Foundation for Future Generations. Il y aura deux autres questions très intéressantes discutées également sur le droit de la relation à la nature et la place de l'humain dans le concept de smart cities.

Puisque nous approchons du second tour, il me paraît important de ne pas laisser passer sans réagir des propos me concernant et qui sont directement liés aux discours de campagne.  Dans cet article de l'Opinion (dont je n'ai lu que les quelques § en libre accès) il est écrit que je pourrais devenir ministre dans un gouvernement nommé par Macron réélu.  Précisions : - je n'ai pas été contacté par l'auteure de ce papier - je n'ai jamais eu envie d'être ministre ou d'avoir un mandat politique au sens où on l'entend habituellement (député, maire etc) - en conséquence de quoi je n'ai jamais dit à personne chez LREM (ou ailleurs) que je souhaitais occuper cette fonction et que j'aurais récemment changé d'avis sur ce sujet.  Incidemment le programme décrit dans https://lnkd.in/esiqHkbf ne relève pas de 2 ministres particuliers. Il demanderait le concours de l'ensemble du gouvernement puisque quand il y a un projet de société il n'est pas détachable "du reste" qui ne serait pas concerné !

QuotaClimat Demain, c'est le débat de l'entre-deux-tours. Et si on suggérait aux journalistes Léa Salamé et Gilles Bouleau quelques questions à poser aux deux candidats sur le climat !  QUESTIONS DE BASE (juste pour bien savoir de quoi on parle)  De combien la température a-t-elle déjà augmenté depuis de début de l'ère industrielle dans le monde et en France ?  Quel est le rythme de réchauffement actuel par décennie ?  En conséquence, en quelle année atteindrons-nous l'objectif de +1,5°C que l'Accord de Paris fixait pour 2100 ?  SUR L'ÉNERGIE  Pourquoi toujours réduire le débat sur l'énergie au mix électrique et le débat sur le mix électrique au nucléaire vs renouvelable ?   Pourquoi ne pas clairement poser le débat sur la sobriété, alors que l'on doit réduire la consommation énergétique finale de 50 % en 2050 par rapport à 2012, avec un objectif intermédiaire de 20 % en 2030 ?  SUR L'ADAPTATION  Quel est le pourcentage de la population française déjà exposée de manière forte ou très forte au risque climatique ?  Que prévoyez-vous pour adapter la France aux conséquences du changement climatique et avec quel budget ?  SUR L'AGRICULTURE   Qu'allez-vous faire pour que la déclinaison française de la PAC soit conforme aux exigences écologiques de la Commission européenne (stratégie "Farm to Fork"), qui vient de demander à la France de revoir son plan stratégique national (PSN) pour 2023-2027 (information du site Contexte)  QUESTIONS SPÉCIALES POUR LE PRÉSIDENT SORTANT Sachant que le programme de Marine Le Pen est tout simplement un désastre pour le climat, des questions spéciales pour le candidat E. Macron :   Quelles sont les nouvelles mesures proposées qui n’étaient pas déjà dans la Convention Citoyenne pour le Climat, et si elles y étaient déjà, comment garantir qu'une nouvelle Assemblée à majorité LREM ne les invalide pas de nouveau ? (question de Christophe Cassou)   Vous avez annoncé que votre 1er ministre aura en charge le climat (avec, à ses côtés, un ministre de la planification énergétique et un ministre de la planification territoriale). Mais pourquoi séparer le climat des autres enjeux, et notamment celui de la biodiversité ?   Garde-t-on un ministre de la transition écologique quitte à avoir 3 ministres en charge, peu ou prou, du même sujet ? (2 questions de Arnaud Gossement)  Quels nouveaux moyens donner aux administrations de l'écologie ? On constate en effet une déconnexion croissante entre les missions qui augmentent et les moyens qui baissent. On ne peut pas faire + avec - (voir ID, l’Info Durable https://lnkd.in/e5YFVaT8).  Pensez vous vraiment que la robotique, la génétique et le numérique sont l'avenir de l'agriculture (comme dit/suggéré dans votre programme et discours) ?  D'autres idées ? Cette liste est bien sûr à compléter. #GoGoGo

Via les Echos, le lobby des éoliennes s'enorgueillit de rembourser les subventions de l'Etat car le prix de l'électricité a été multiplié par 10. Les éoliennes seraient devenues rentables et restitueraient les subventions Etatiques en 2 ans, dont 3,7 MM€ en 2022. Vraiment?  1. L'Etat + le privé investissent ~300 MM€ en énergies intermittentes, sans investissement nouveau dans l'électricité pilotable sur 20 ans. 20 ans plus tard, les centrales pilotables toussent (normal!), et comme les allemands arrêtent leur elec' pilotable, la pénurie guette, les traders d'électricité s'affolent et les prix font *10 2. Les opérateurs d'éoliennes gagnent à tous les coups grâce au "contract for difference". Si le prix de 180 €/MWh n'est pas atteint, l'Etat abonde et paye la différence, si le prix est supérieur, les opérateurs sont rentables et rendent le surplus à l'Etat.  2. Mais l'Etat doit payer ailleurs : comme le prix de l'électricité devient inabordable pour les industries et les ménages, il doit subventionner TOUTE l'électricité (sur une assiette complète de l'électricité ). Pour éviter les fermetures massives d'usines et l'explosion des factures des ménages, 18 MM€ sont dépensés en "bouclier fiscal" rien que cet hiver. Les opérateurs d'éoliennes s'en fichent, puisque leurs marges sont garanties par leur contrat à terme. En revanche les fabricants d'éoliennes dégustent, car les prix des composants métalliques, importées à plus de 85 %, explosent de 250%, ce qui renchérit de 45% les prochaines éoliennes. La CSPE, taxe sur votre facture finançant les prochaines installations a été supprimée dans ce bouclier. Du coup, les opérateurs installés font de l'argent, mais les fabricants licencient à tour de bras. Le leader Européen vient d'annoncer un plan social de 270 personnes. On est loin de relocaliser! Et l'Etat ne pourra pas se permettre de faire un chèque de 18MM€ chaque hiver.  La conclusion est que la structure de ce marché est bancal et risque d'exploser, entraînant une bulle de 300 MM€ dans la tourmente. Un business en France qui ne produit pas de valeur réelle mais juste des problèmes d'intermittence de réseau et qui est en doublon du réseau pilotable, est amené à disparaître. Demain ou dans 5 ans, je n'en sais rien.  Voici un schéma qui explique, sûrement avec des approximations, le système du "contract for difference". Si l'électricité n'est pas assez chère par rapport à l'éolien, l'Etat donne aux marchands d'éoliennes, et si c'est trop cher, l'Etat subventionne les contribuables. Les opérateurs existants ne peuvent plus investir dans de nouvelles installations, ni dans de nouveaux clients (car lorsqu'il n'y a pas de vent, il faudrait payer l'électricité au prix marché de gros et non le prix Arenh, donc revendre à perte!).  Donc si les éoliennes sont rentables par pénurie de Pilotable, c'est que l'Etat, les industriels et les pauvres payent cher.    https://lnkd.in/dnDXj-TE
